intro: Anil sabulicola, commonly known as sand anil, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, violet-blue flowers that bloom during the cooler months. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is often cultivated in xeriscapes and botanical gardens.
